term.title: Huggins equation

item.text: The equation describing the dependence of the reduced viscosity, η i c, on the mass concentration of a polymer, c, for dilute polymer solutions of the form: η i c = η + k H η 2 c is the Huggins coefficient and [η] is the intrinsic viscosity.

item.title: intrinsic viscosity (of a polymer) (of a polymer)
intrinsic viscosity (of a polymer) (of a polymer)

item.alttext: η i c = η + k H η 2 c
